title: Legislative Assembly Fair Work Week emails

communications.subject: Oregon Public Records Law Request: Legislative Assembly Fair Work Week emails
communications.communication:
Date: July 5, 2024

To:

Legislative Branch Public Records Request
c/o Office of the Legislative Counsel
900 Court Street NE S101
Salem, Oregon 97301-4065
Email: Leg.RecReq@oregonlegislature.gov

From:

Peter Fugiel
Postdoctoral Research Fellow
Rutgers School of Management and Labor Relations

Dear Public Records Staff,

I am writing to request public records from the Oregon Legislative Assembly for academic research on scheduling legislation. Specifically, I am requesting:

Emails sent or received between January 1, 2016, and December 31, 2017, by any Legislator or their staff containing the phrase "fair work week" in the message text or attachments, excluding internal advisory communications. I request that the responsive records be provided in electronic format. 

I request a fee waiver because my research is in the public interest as judged by the National Science Foundation (award # 2203815). But if there are any fees associated with fulfilling this request, please provide an estimate of these costs before proceeding. If my request is unclear or too broad, I would appreciate your assistance in narrowing the scope.

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your response as soon as practicable or within five business days.

Sincerely,

Peter Fugiel
Postdoctoral Research Fellow
Rutgers School of Management and Labor Relations
c/o MuckRock News
411A Highland Ave
Somerville, MA 02144-2516
peter.fugiel@rutgers.edu
260-468-8528

communications.subject: Fwd: Public Records Request PRR 732
communications.communication:
---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Leg RecReq <Leg.RecReq@oregonlegislature.gov>
Date: Tue, Jul 9, 2024 at 10:27 AM
Subject: Public Records Request PRR 732
To: peter.fugiel@rutgers.edu <peter.fugiel@rutgers.edu>


Good morning Peter,



Attached please find an acknowledgment letter regarding your recent public
records request.



Before we begin the process of collecting any records potentially
responsive to your request, I’d like to share some information with you
about fees associated with records requests received by Oregon’s
Legislative Branch, and to that end, I have attached our fee policy. In
short, though: your request, as is, may qualify for a 40% fee reduction,
but it does not qualify for a fee waiver. To qualify for a fee waiver, the
request, among other things, must be narrowly tailored to preserve public
resources, which it is not as it seeks records from a two year period from
roughly 90 offices. Speaking more frankly, I can also tell you that a
search in our e-mail records collection tool of “fair work week”
unfortunately won’t only return hits with “fair work week” -- it will
return anything with “fair,” “work,” or “week” in it, which I’m sure you
can imagine will create countless (likely many thousands of) records that
are not responsive to your request and that will need to be sorted through
before we can provide you with the records that are responsive.



If you would like to read through the attached policy and can confirm that
your request meets all of the qualifications for a fee reduction, I can
proceed with the request as is and will grant you the 40% fee reduction,
but would ask for your patience as this request will take months of work to
complete. I am also happy to work with you to help you reconfigure your
request to be more specific (for example, by narrowing the search window,
or seeking records from fewer offices) so that we can grant that full fee
waiver. If we do proceed with a fee reduction only, I will make sure to
communicate a fee estimate before we actually begin processing your request.



Please let me know how you would like to proceed once you’ve had a chance
to read through the attached policy document.



Best,



*Michael Burns *|* Legal and Public Records Assistant*

Office of the Legislative Counsel

Office: 503.986.1243

[image: http://intranet/CapitolImages/Oregon%20State%20Seal%20-%20Color.jpg]

files.title: prr732 acknowledgment
files.source: Oregon Legislative Assembly, Oregon

communications.subject: Re: Public Records Request PRR 732
communications.communication:
Dear Michael,

Thank you for acknowledging my request and sharing the fee reduction/waiver
policy. I understand the need to weigh the public interest in the records
requested against the burden of retrieving and reviewing them. I would be
happy to narrow my request by limiting the number of email accounts and
period of time.

Before I revise my request, I wonder if you could clarify how these records
(legislative email messages and attachments) are stored and searched for
the purposes of public records requests. I am surprised to learn that your
collection tool does not allow for compound search terms or operators (e.g.
fair AND work AND week). One way of working around this limitation might be
to narrow the keyword search to certain fields, e.g. the email subject or
attachment file name. Another possibility would be to search for records
containing relevant bill numbers (SB878, SB888) instead of common words.
But I'm not sure if you can search specific fields or metadata of these
emails. I would appreciate any further information or assistance you could
provide in tailoring my request.

All the best,
Peter

files.title: image001
files.source: Oregon Legislative Assembly, Oregon

communications.subject: RE: Public Records Request PRR 732
communications.communication:
Hi Peter,

I’m glad you asked, because it gave me an opportunity to check in with the team that pulls e-mails for us (our IT folks are the ones who pull the records, while we review, redact, and discuss/disseminate them with/to the various concerned parties.) What they told me is that compound search terms with operators do (read: should) work, and that if I am seeing results that contradict that we can investigate why. Since I frequently see evidence to the contrary, I’ll have an opportunity to review with them the next time the issue comes up. It’s quite possible that user error (i.e. using operators in lower case instead of all caps) yielded nonresponsive records in the past. Thankfully we do always find the correct records (assuming they exist)... we just tend to end up with a lot of separating the wheat from the chaff, which isn’t practical for obvious reasons.

The tool they use, by the way, is Office 365 eDiscovery. It doesn’t allow you to limit what fields you’re searching in, but if you’re curious, this<https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/purview/ediscovery-keyword-queries-and-search-conditions?view=o365-worldwide> article discusses the ins-and-outs of how to use it.

As for your current request: really, I can limit it however you’d like. The goal here is to make sure you are getting the records you want and are entitled to, so I’d like to make sure we’re doing it right. I’ll just need you to specify the conditions so I’m not misinterpreting anything. We can use your original search terms, and can also add SB###, SB ###, Senate Bill ###, etc. to the list of terms. The search will find hits in both e-mails and attachments. The biggest issue remains the number of accounts you’re asking us to pull records from, and the best advice I can offer is to limit your search to members of the Legislative Assembly and committees that actually worked on whichever bills you’re interested in. You’ll need to do the research on that if that’s a route you’d like to take, but OLIS<https://www.oregonlegislature.gov/bills_laws/Pages/previous-session-bills.aspx> is a great place to start.

I’ll await further correspondence. Have a great day in the meantime.

Michael

communications.subject: RE: Oregon Public Records Law Request: Legislative Assembly Fair Work Week emails
communications.communication:
Good morning Michael,

I appreciate you checking with your IT colleagues and clarifying the functionality of the Office 365 eDiscovery tool. I would like to narrow my request for emails and attachments to the period 1/1/2017–12/31/2017 and the following eight members of the Legislative Assembly: Senate President Peter Courtney, Senator Michael Dembrow, Senator Tim Knopp, Senator Alan DeBoer, Senator Ted Ferrioli, House Speaker Tina Kotek, Representative Kathleen Taylor, or Representative Greg Barreto. I would like to add the bill number (828) as an alternate search term. Putting these modifications together, here is my revised request:

Emails sent or received between January 1, 2017 and December 31, 2017 by Greg Barreto, Peter Courtney, Alan DeBoer, Michael Dembrow, Ted Ferrioli, Tina Kotek, Tim Knopp, or Kathleen Taylor that contain the compound phrase "fair AND work AND week" OR the number 828 in the message text or attachments, excluding internal advisory communications.

Please note that I am most interested in records that deal with the provisions, amendments, testimony, deliberations, or votes on this measure. If my search returns records that merely list the bill with its sponsors, status, or other summary information, you may exclude these records from your review and response.

Thank you for your assistance,
Peter

communications.subject: RE: Oregon Public Records Law Request: Legislative Assembly Fair Work Week emails
communications.communication:
Peter, thank you. I will put in a request for the records and will get back to you when I have an update.

Micnael

communications.subject: RE: Oregon Public Records Law Request: Legislative Assembly Fair Work Week emails
communications.communication:
Good morning Peter,

Thanks for checking in and for your patience.

For your request, there are ~1,000 potentially responsive records. I completed an initial review on those yesterday and am preparing to distribute them to target offices who will need to review them for any potential redactions or exemptions before we send them out to you. I expect to send them to the target offices this Friday, with a one-week timeframe for their review. Once that’s done, I’ll need to apply any applicable redactions. At this point I expect to have records ready to deliver to you by Monday, August 12th. If for whatever reason we can’t make that deadline, I will update you with a new ETA.
Best,

Michael

communications.subject: RE: Oregon Public Records Law Request: Legislative Assembly Fair Work Week emails
communications.communication:
Good morning Michael,

Thank you for the update. I look forward to receiving the records once your colleagues have reviewed them and you apply any applicable redactions.

All the best,
Peter

communications.subject: Public Records Request PRR 732
communications.communication:
Peter,

Attached please find a disclosure letter regarding your public records request, as well as DropBox links to all responsive records for which an exemption was not claimed. Please note that a few of the legislators you specified (Alan DeBoer, Ted Ferrioli, and Greg Barreto) have been retired from the Legislative Assembly long enough that the retention period on their records has expired, and thus we haven't provided those as we simply don't have them anymore.

Best of luck on your research, and apologies for the number of records in here that actually don't tell the story of the evolution of the laws you are interested in (i.e. newsletters mentioning "fair work week" legislation)--separating those out would actually have taken considerably more time, making it harder to justify the full fee waiver. That said, I hope you'll find what you are looking for here.

This completes our response to your request.

Records:

Rep Tina Kotek1<https://www.dropbox.com/scl/fi/80ko4qt3v4ci30w6t72md/prr732-records-Rep.TinaKotek.pdf?rlkey=jz6svfio4xc9g1xktu4bpg1nw&st=qscj1iz4&dl=0>

title: Usage of the cellular Emergency Alert System

communications.subject: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: Usage of the cellular Emergency Alert System
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I'd like to request a copy of any policies related to the county's direct usage of the cellular emergency alert system.

Additionally, I'd like all information related to which individuals may use the system.

Finally, I'd appreciate information regarding any procedures/protocols that were followed related to any usage, by the county, of the Emergency Alert system in the past 6 months.

I am a resident of the Town of Wytheville, Wythe County, and the Commonwealth of Virginia, and do no require a local proxy to file this request.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tom Nash, a citizen of Virginia, in coordination with Robert McWhirter.

title: ICE Public Affairs Responses to In-Custody Deaths at Aurora, Torrance

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: ICE Public Affairs Responses to In-Custody Deaths at Aurora, Torrance
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

On behalf of the Al Otro Lado #DetentionKills Transparency Initiative, we respectfully request all records created or received by ICE's Office of Public Affairs at the Headquarters, El Paso Field Office, and Denver Field Office levels regarding the deaths in custody of Kesley Dial at CoreCivic's Torrance, New Mexico facility and The GEO Group's Aurora, Colorado facility. Specifically, we seek emails sent or received, calendar entries for appointments to discuss either of the deaths in custody, Teams messages, the contents of SharePoint drive folders regarding ICE's public statements regarding these deaths, and any records relied upon to assert the factual matters in ICE's post-death release statements, posted here: 
https://www.ice.gov/news/releases/brazilian-man-ice-custody-passes-away-new-mexico-hospital?s=09
and here: 
https://www.ice.gov/news/releases/nicaraguan-man-ice-custody-passes-away-colorado-hospital

By definition, the information requested cannot be subject to withholding under Exemption 7A (open investigations), because ICE has already released its core facts publicly.

We seek expedited processing of this request under 6 C.F.R. 5.5(e), and make the following statements under penalty of perjury pursuant to 28 USC 1746 in support thereof: 
1. Both the Torrance in-custody death and the Aurora in-custody death have been met with calls from elected Representatives and Senators for vigorous investigation, based on each facility's documented track record. See https://www.heinrich.senate.gov/newsroom/press-releases/heinrich-leads-request-for-immediate-action-from-ice-to-address-inhumane-unsafe-conditions-for-migrants-at-the-torrance-county-detention-facility and https://crow.house.gov/sites/evo-subsites/crow.house.gov/files/evo-media-document/2022.10.21-final-icedhs-letter_0.pdf. 

2. Both deaths have been the subject of widespread and sustained media attention. 
For Torrance: 
https://www.nytimes.com/2022/09/22/us/politics/aclu-ice-immigration-detention.html
https://sourcenm.com/2022/09/01/brazilian-asylum-seeker-who-died-by-suicide-held-in-horrific-conditions-attorneys-say/
https://nmpoliticalreport.com/2022/08/31/immigrant-advocacy-organizations-seeking-answers-around-brazilian-mans-death-by-suicide-while-in-ice-custody/
https://www.democracynow.org/2022/10/18/headlines/asylum_seekers_at_torrance_ice_jail_claim_retaliation_over_hunger_strike
https://theappeal.org/torrance-detention-center-kesley-vial-brazil/
https://www.santafenewmexican.com/opinion/letters_to_editor/close-torrance-county-ice-facility-now/article_08a7cf58-5705-11ed-b432-1bb650ab5a32.html
https://www.krqe.com/news/crime/man-commits-suicide-in-ice-custody-in-torrance-county/
https://www.democracynow.org/2022/8/29/headlines/asylum_seeker_dies_by_suicide_at_for_profit_ice_jail_in_new_mexico
https://www.abqjournal.com/2528527/webhedline-126.html
https://www.lcsun-news.com/story/news/local/new-mexico/2022/09/30/groups-retaliation-after-migrants-report-torrance-county-detention-center/69530415007/

For Aurora: 
https://www.cpr.org/2022/10/27/colorado-lawmakers-call-for-investigation-into-death-at-aurora-ice-facility/
https://www.cpr.org/2022/11/03/advocates-immigration-customs-enforcement-custody-death/
https://www.9news.com/article/news/local/man-nicaragua-dies-aurora-ice-facility/73-f52d0d45-531c-4e17-a361-1376d887e499
https://www.denver7.com/news/local-news/colorado-lawmakers-call-for-probe-after-detainees-death-at-aurora-ice-facility
https://www.cbsnews.com/colorado/news/melvin-ariel-calero-mendoza-nicaraguan-father-dies-ice-custody-aurora-facility/
https://www.longmontleader.com/local-news/el-comite-wants-answers-to-ice-detention-death-5990654
https://news.yahoo.com/video/nicaraguan-father-two-dies-ice-040542382.html
https://www.newsbreak.com/news/2810691040469/report-details-what-led-up-to-man-s-death-in-aurora-ice-custody

3. In both cases, serious questions have been raised by elected officials as to the circumstances surrounding each person's death, and ICE and its contractors' compliance with mandatory duties surrounding care of detained immigrants. 

Therefore, the requirements of 6 C.F.R. 5.5(e) are satisfied, and expedited processing is proper. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this important request, and your response within the statutorily required 10-calendar day period! 

#DetentionKills Transparency Initiative
Al Otro Lado

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Andrew Free

communications.subject: RE: ICE FOIA Case Number 2023-ICFO-03462
communications.communication:
12/21/2022Andrew FreeMuckRock News, DEPT MR136588Boston, Massachusetts 02115RE:	ICE FOIA Case Number 2023-ICFO-03462        Dear Requester:This acknowledges receipt of your 11/8/2022, Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request to U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE), for all records created or received by ICE's Office of Public Affairs at the Headquarters, El Paso Field Office, and Denver Field Office levels regarding the deaths in custody of Kesley Dial at CoreCivic's Torrance, New Mexico facility and The GEO Group's Aurora, Colorado facility. .  Your request was received in this office on 11/8/2022.After careful review of your FOIA request, we determined that your request is 1) too broad in scope, 2) did not specifically identify the records which you are seeking, or 3) only posed questions to the agency.  Records must be described in reasonably sufficient detail to enable government employees who are familiar with the subject area to locate records without placing an unreasonable burden upon the agency.  For this reason, §5.3(b) of the DHS regulations, 6 C.F.R. Part 5, require that you describe the records you are seeking with as much information as possible to ensure that our search can locate them with a reasonable amount of effort.  Whenever possible, a request should include specific information about each record sought, such as the date, title or name, author, recipients, and subject matter of the records, if known, or the ICE program office you believe created and/or controls the record.  The FOIA does not require an agency to create new records, answer questions posed by requesters, or attempt to interpret a request that does not identify specific records.  Please resubmit your request containing a reasonable description of the records you are seeking.  Upon receipt of a perfected request, you will be advised as to the status of your request.If we do not hear from you within 30 days from the date of this letter, we will assume you are no longer interested in this FOIA request, and the case will be administratively closed.  Please be advised that this action is not a denial of your request and will not preclude you from filing other requests in the future. If you have any questions please contact FOIA Public Liaison Marcus Francis at (866) 633-1182 or the address above.Your request has been assigned reference number 2023-ICFO-03462. Sincerely,ICE-FOIA

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #2023-ICFO-03462
communications.communication:
We appeal the agency’s determination that the request is improper. 

It seeks:

“emails sent or received, calendar entries for appointments to discuss either of the deaths in custody, Teams messages, the contents of SharePoint drive folders regarding ICE's public statements regarding these deaths, and any records relied upon to assert the factual matters in ICE's post-death release statements, posted [on ICE’s website].”

We seek expedited processing of this request for the reasons described in our original submission. 

#DetentionKills Transparency Initiative 
Al Otro Lado

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #2023-ICAP-00243
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

I wanted to follow up on the following Freedom of Information Act request, copied below, and originally submitted on Nov. 8, 2022. Please let me know when I can expect to receive a response.  You had assigned it reference number #2023-ICAP-00243.

Thanks for your help, and let me know if further clarification is needed.

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #2023-ICAP-00243
communications.communication:
You have reached SecureRelease Support.

The purpose of this inbox is to provide technical support for the SecureRelease FOIA Request Portal website (https://www.securerelease.us/).

SecureRelease website support staff are not involved with the processing or prioritization of requests, and this inbox is not monitored by agency personnel.

According to our records, request 2023-ICAP-00243 was not submitted through the SecureRelease Request Portal, therefore, we are unable to provide online status tracking or portal messaging capabilities for this request.

We have CC’ed the ICE FOIA inbox for visibility. To follow up further on this request, please refer to communications you received from the agency for contact instructions or reach out to the agency in the same manner that you submitted your request.

Regards,

SecureRelease™ Support Team
securereleasesupportteam@deloitte.com<mailto:securereleasesupportteam@deloitte.com>
www.securerelease.us<http://www.securerelease.us>

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #2023-ICAP-00243
communications.communication:
Good day,

In regards to 2023-ICAP+00243, we have queried the appropriate component of DHS for responsive records.  If any responsive records are located, they will be reviewed for determination of releasability.  We will process your request as expeditiously as possible.  Upon completion of the processing, all documents that can be released will be made available to you as soon as possible.

Thank you,
ICE FOIA

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #2023-ICAP-00243
communications.communication:
You are legally required to provide an estimated date on which documents will be produced.

You are legally required to make a determination on this request and inform us of it. 

You are legally required to make records promptly available. 

You have failed to comply with any of these requirements. 

If you have any intention of doing so within the next fourteen days, please inform us. 

Thank you.

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #2023-ICAP-00243
communications.communication:
Good afternoon, 

Your assertion that “a high number of FOIA requests have been received by the Department” is unsupported by the Department’s own FY22 Chief FOIA Officer Report. In other words, you’re saying a thing that your own data demonstrate is untrue. 

But go off, I guess. 

Thank you, 

Andrew Free

communications.subject: ICE FOIA 2024-ICAP-00071, 2024-ICFO-06913
communications.communication:
12/12/2023 

Andrew Free 
MuckRock News, DEPT MR136588 
Boston, Massachusetts 02115 

RE:	ICE FOIA Case Number 2024-ICAP-00071, 2024-ICFO-06913 

Dear Requester: 

The Department of Homeland Security has received your letter appealing the adverse determination of your Freedom of Information Act/Privacy Act (FOIA/PA) request by U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement. Your appeal, postmarked or electronically transmitted on 11/22/2023, was received on 12/11/2023. 

The Government Information Law Division acknowledges your appeal request of and is assigning it number 2024-ICAP-00071 for tracking purposes.  Please reference this number in any future communications about your appeal. 

A high number of FOIA/PA requests have been received by the Department.  Accordingly, we have adopted the court-sanctioned practice of generally handling backlogged appeals on a first-in, first-out basis.   While we will make every effort to process your appeal on a timely basis, there may be some delay in resolving this matter.  Should you have any questions concerning the processing of your appeal, please contact Fernando Pineiro Jr., ICE FOIA Office/Public Liaison at (866) 633-1182 or at 500 12th St., SW Washington, DC 20536-5009. 

Sincerely, 
 
Sara Jazayeri 
Acting Chief 
Government Information Law Division 
ICE Office of the Principal Legal Advisor 
U.S. Department of Homeland Security

RE:	ICE FOIA 2024-ICAP-00162 
 
Dear Requester: 

This email is in response to your status inquiry regarding ICE FOIA 2024-ICAP-00162, in which you have requested Appeal. This will capture the combined time frame for records from April 1, 2021, through December 15, 2023.. 

As of today, the search for responsive documents is complete and your request is currently in queue to be processed. If responsive records have been located, they will be reviewed for a determination of releasability. 

ICE FOIA apologizes for the delay in the processing of your request. Please be assured that one of the processors in our office will respond to your request as expeditiously as possible. We appreciate your patience as we proceed with your request. 

If you have any questions, please contact FOIA Public Liaison, Daniel Edgington at the address above or (866) 633-1182. Additionally, you have a right to seek dispute resolution services from the Office of Government Information Services (OGIS) which mediates disputes between FOIA requesters and Federal agencies as a non-exclusive alternative to litigation.  If you are requesting access to your own records (which is considered a Privacy Act request), you should know that OGIS does not have the authority to handle requests made under the Privacy Act of 1974.  You may contact OGIS as follows:  Office of Government Information Services, National Archives and Records Administration, 8601 Adelphi Road-OGIS, College Park, Maryland 20740-6001, e-mail at ogis@nara.gov; telephone at 202-741-5770; toll free at 1-877-684-6448. 

Your request has been assigned reference number 2024-ICAP-00162. Please use this number in future correspondence. 

Sincerely, 

ICE FOIA Office

500 12th Street, S.W., Stop 5009

communications.subject: ICE FOIA 2024-ICAP-00127
communications.communication:
08/12/2024 

Andrew Free 
MuckRock News, DEPT MR136588 
Boston, Massachusetts 02115 

RE:	ICE FOIA Case Number 2024-ICAP-00127 

Dear Requester: 

This letter is the final response to your Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) Appeal on remand. You had appealed an adverse determination of your request dated 1/23/2024. 

We have considered your request under the both the FOIA, 5 U.S.C. § 552, and the Privacy Act Privacy Act, 5 U.S.C. § 552a.  After review of the documents, I have determined that portions of documents will be withheld pursuant to Exemption 6 of the Privacy Act and Exemptions 7 of the FOIA as described below. 

FOIA Exemption 5 protects from disclosure those inter- or intra-agency documents that are normally privileged in the civil discovery context.  The three most frequently invoked privileges are the deliberative process privilege, the attorney work-product privilege, and the attorney-client privilege.  After carefully reviewing the responsive documents, I have determined that portions of the responsive documents qualify for protection under the deliberative process privilege/ attorney work-product privilege/ attorney-client privilege/ or all three.  The deliberative process privilege protects the integrity of the deliberative or decision-making processes within the agency by exempting from mandatory disclosure opinions, conclusions, and recommendations included within inter-agency or intra-agency memoranda or letters.  The release of this internal information would discourage the expression of candid opinions and inhibit the free and frank exchange of information among agency personnel. The attorney work-product privilege protects documents and other memoranda prepared by an attorney in contemplation of litigation. 

FOIA Exemption 6 exempts from disclosure personnel or medical files and similar files the release of which would cause a clearly unwarranted invasion of personal privacy.  This requires a balancing of the public’s right to disclosure against the individual’s right privacy.  The types of documents and/or information that we have withheld may consist of social security numbers, home addresses, dates of birth, or various other documents and/or information belonging to a third party that are considered personal.  The privacy interests of the individuals in the records you have requested outweigh any minimal public interest in disclosure of the information.  Any private interest you may have in that information does not factor into the aforementioned balancing test. 

FOIA Exemption 7(C) protects records or information compiled for law enforcement purposes that could reasonably be expected to constitute an unwarranted invasion of personal privacy.  This exemption takes particular note of the strong interests of individuals, whether they are suspects, witnesses, or investigators, in not being unwarrantably associated with alleged criminal activity.  That interest extends to persons who are not only the subjects of the investigation, but those who may have their privacy invaded by having their identities and information about them revealed in connection with an investigation.  Based upon the traditional recognition of strong privacy interest in law enforcement records, categorical withholding of information that identifies third parties in law enforcement records is ordinarily appropriate.  As such, I have determined that the privacy interest in the identities of individuals in the records you have requested clearly outweigh any minimal public interest in disclosure of the information.  Please note that any private interest you may have in that information does not factor into this determination. 

Exemption 7(E) protects records compiled for law enforcement purposes, the release of which would disclose techniques and/or procedures for law enforcement investigations or prosecutions, or would disclose guidelines for law enforcement investigations or prosecutions if such disclosure could reasonably be expected to risk circumvention of the law.  I determined that disclosure of law enforcement systems checks could reasonably be expected to risk circumvention of the law.  Additionally, the techniques and procedures at issue are not well known to the public. 

If you have any questions please contact FOIA Public Liaison Daniel Edgington at (866) 633-1182 or 500 12th St., SW Stop 5009 Washington, DC 20536-5009. 

Sincerely, 

Supervisory Paralegal Specialist

files.source: Immigration and Customs Enforcement, United States of America

title: McLennan County Administrator Dustin Chapman, Grand Jury Foreperson Name

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: McLennan County Administrator Dustin Chapman, Grand Jury Foreperson Name
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Name of current Grand Jury Foreperson, best address to write Grand Jury Foreperson registered letter, next Grand Jury meeting date

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Bernadette Feazell

If she wants to submit something for the foreman to review, she can address it to the district clerk’s office, attn: Grand Jury Foreman.  It would then be up to the foremen to decide how/if to proceed.

communications.subject: RE: Texas Public Information Act Request: McLennan County Administrator Dustin Chapman, Grand Jury Foreperson Name
communications.communication:
Since we all know what is going on here, let's get us a nice AG's Opinion,shall we? Mr. Tetens' knows about the working on County Time of Johnathan Crawley. He has shown no interest whatsoever, and I, as a Citizen am ENTITLED TOTALLY to the name of the Grand Jury Foreperson. I also do NOT have to go to the District Clerk, I can put it into the hand of the foreperson.

You are acting rather guilty and I am not the only one that has noticed this. 

There is LAW and it's not on your side. Vic Feazell was indicted for a lot less than this.

150K in free garden work paid for by the County.
Obviously, you are scared of the truth.

You know full well this is true and are scared to death, not just scared, you are complicit. 

As an Officer of the Court, YOU, TETENS have already failed in your duty to go forward with this. Other Officers of the Court have been to the FBI and I guess the question is, how stupid and crooked are you in your constant attempts to make this truth go away???????

There are hospital records the Grand Jury should ask for, YOU should ask for but you do not. Scared?
There are "pings" from the radio locating the car Crawley was using, oops, you forgot? The radio checks will show where his location was.

The fact that there are no body cams, in the opinion of OTHER LAW ENFORCEMENT AGENCIES is also proof of Parnell NOT Wanting people to know where people were, hence, Crawley and his Sheriff's dept. car.

Hello?

I am asking for the name of the Grand Jury foreperson.
Your b.s. District Clerk pass off, is further evidence of YOUR crime and being complicit in this cover up.

Hope your law license is worth this, all of you.

xoxo
B

communications.subject: Re: Texas Public Information Act Request: McLennan County Administrator Dustin Chapman, Grand Jury Foreperson Name
communications.communication: I have forwarded your response to the DA and District Clerk.  The County Judge's Office is not the custodian of grand jury records.  Those are records of the District Courts and, hence, why the request was sent to the District Clerk.  I will follow-up when I get a response.

communications.subject: Re: Texas Public Information Act Request: McLennan County Administrator Dustin Chapman, Grand Jury Foreperson Name
communications.communication:
Please see the below from Jon Gimble...

We currently do not have a Grand Jury empaneled.  Thus the suggestion to address to this office attn: Grand Jury Foreman.  A new Grand Jury is scheduled to be created tomorrow.

communications.subject: RE: Texas Public Information Act Request: McLennan County Administrator Dustin Chapman, Grand Jury Foreperson Name
communications.communication:
Dustin, I send stuff to you because I can,  I send it to you so you can transmit the "gossip" where it needs to go. 

The entire county, including you, after all, YOU have a law license too and are an "officer of the court", and our District Clerk should be more than interested in 150K worth of work done by Johnathan Crawley for Parnell at his house paid for by the county taxpayers. Get real.
That Josh Tetens was told by me in front of witnesses who heard me, and him at the Republican Club WITH Brittany Lannen, at that time she was waiting to sign a contract to represent the Crawleys and was AT the Republican Club with me and others rather upset at the entire situation. Tetens was given the opportunity to talk to her and he said he didn't need to because he believed her. 

That I want and am forced to go to the Grand Jury Foreperson myself is a travesty in itself and you know it. 

Tetens has had phone calls from other people who wanted to tell him what happened and he does not even call them back.

I have emails and texts between myself and this DA and now I am satisfied that THIS is a travesty. I along with many, many others have been to the Federal authorities about this because YOU people simply don't care. However, you have law licenses and I have proof.

I feel quite sure that you, Mr. Chapman would indeed rather have your head in the sand, it's oh, so much nicer, however, there is proof, witnesses and people who will not lie.

This has been going on since February the sixth and I, am quite tired of playing little games with you "boys" I have statements, texts, and on the other hand, your incompetence and total lack of "curiosity" about the matter. i suspect you talked to ole Par and he assured you I was crazy, well, let's see how this plays out. Remember you all KNOW about this so you're all culpable because of your knowledge and failure as officers of the court to do anything.

Let's stop and think how my Complaint against not getting the name of the Grand Jury Foreperson along with this story plus evidence is going to play at the AG's office, then they too will  have the knowledge of a crime .....

Your DA won't take this to the Grand Jury or even return calls from people who were there. The taxpayers paid 150K for this, Crawley himself is willing to tell any of you that call him and yet you don't. He told ME. 

So you non curious good old boys just transfer what needs to go to what department and play your game. 
I have evidence and truth on my side.
Let's play.
I have 60K read me every day which equates to 47% of the voting public and that was BEFORE Parnell and Charlotte and the County yellow tape at the old mansion debaucle.

What is wrong with you?
Truly.

communications.subject: RE: Texas Public Information Act Request: McLennan County Administrator Dustin Chapman, Grand Jury Foreperson Name
communications.communication:
I am not nice, I am not liked much,  and I don't care one bit about you public servants and your whining cover ups. I notice you got a nice raise for being a lawyer, Chapman, well be one. Fortitude? Or do you just care about lining the pockets of contractors and Judges. You're the first LAWYER they've had in this position, so be one.
Bernadette Feazell

communications.subject: Re: Texas Public Information Act Request: McLennan County Administrator Dustin Chapman, Grand Jury Foreperson Name
communications.communication: Once the grand jury foreperson is selected, we will send you his/her name.  But by law, we cannot send you his/her personal address or other personal information.

communications.subject: RE: Texas Public Information Act Request: McLennan County Administrator Dustin Chapman, Grand Jury Foreperson Name
communications.communication:
Dustin, 
IF I had wanted the Grand Jury Foreperson's address I would have asked for it. I know better and knew that before you were born.
I would appreciate it if you didn't treat me like I was stupid. You certainly assume a lot, no wonder you have to work for someone else instead of as a real lawyer. Do you treat all women like they're stupid? 
Condescending, that's the word. 
Stop assuming I am not going somewhere with this. Unfortunately, I can't stop assuming you're 
one of them and trying your best to NOT do anything to rock your cushy boat.

I know not to ask for the address and you have angered me by treating me this way, how long have you hated women?

communications.subject: RE: Texas Public Information Act Request: McLennan County Administrator Dustin Chapman, Grand Jury Foreperson Name
communications.communication:
Please stop assuming I am stupid. Please, just for one minute, how about it. I already told you I don't want the home address, are you nuts?
You just cannot stop yourself, can you?

I know better, YOU, however, just want to insult me over and over again, hope that's working out for you.

communications.communication:
I found the below request on Muckrock.  It was not sent to my email address so I am responding to a previous request since I cannot respond directly.  It appears to have an identifier of “169830.”  I have sent the request to the SO and to HR.

Subject: None
None
To Whom It May Concern:
Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:
Silly me I asked for the Questionnaires, I thought any idiot would realize I wanted the ANSWERS to the questionnaires, but you thought you'd be cute and redact the answers. Hope buying yourself three weeks was worth it. Also, you know I don't drive so it would be nice if you'd do the answers in the NORMAL WAY and not put them on a thumb drive so you can have me trot on down there and you can see who brought me. That's what this is, isn't it? Inconvenience and a few giggles, well, send me the answers to the questionnaires, and the other stuff you neglected to ad. Keep thinking everyone is stupid. Go ahead it's served you well so far, right?
Dustin, dear, you can go ahead and write me another little bitch out note about how this has nothing to do with Felton but we both know that at this point, it does. Plus, YOU are still an officer of the court. Tick tock.
We request all responsive ANSWERS from the employees and any further correspondence from any supervisor to any employee or from supervisor to supervisor to the questionnaire's that we received in open records. We request all documentation that accompanied these questions and their answers and further request and disciplinary measures that generated from any questionnaires that have been handed out by ANY supervisor in the past 13 months.
All letters of explanation from Aaron Burns, James Wolfe, Brad Stovall, Tim Davenport, Martin Arellano, Rose Peterson, Dustin Losak, Pete Peterson, Hunter Herring, Parnell McNamara, Jeremy Bost, Cody Blossman, Mike Gates, Colt Braziel, All Jail Sgt's. Any questionnaires that any of the employees have answered in the past 13 months, any letters
We also request any and all disciplinary actions that have been issued since Cody Blossman has been Chief Deputy or in the past 13 months. We would like to include all disciplinary records that are being kept in supervisors desk and not placed in the personnel files as these are government documents and we are requesting them. The fact that these disciplinary records may be being kept in a desk or file does not exempt them from being subject to open records as all disciplinary measures are open to the public to view.
We request the names of all employees who have resigned or been terminated from the McLennan County Sheriffs Office since Cody Blossman has been chief deputy or in the past 13 months.
We further request any and all emails and correspondence between Cody Blossman and Anna Picasso for the past 13 months.
The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.
In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.
Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.
Sincerely,
Bernadette Feazell

title: Virginia State Open Records Law - Request

communications.subject: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: Virginia State Open Records Law - Request
communications.communication:
Dear Sir / Madam,  

I am writing to ask for your help with a request under the Virginia State Open Records Law, Va Code sec §2.2-3700 - §2.2-3714. 

Would it be possible for you to send me a copy of any records that would show some or all of the following information: 

A list of ALL types of alternative asset investments, including private equity, venture capital, distressed debt, mezzanine, fund of funds, infrastructure, natural resources, real estate and private debt partnerships in which «Entity» is an investor; and 

For each partnership, may I please have a copy of any alternative assets investment records that would show some or all of the following information: 

Richmond Retirement System's total commitment to the partnership, 
the total contributions made by Richmond Retirement System to the partnership to date, 
the total distributions received by Richmond Retirement System from the partnership to date, 
the estimated current value of Richmond Retirement System's holding in the partnership, and 
any available estimates of the Net and Gross IRR earned by Richmond Retirement System to date on its investment in the partnership. 

In addition to this could you please provide me with an up to date account of your current asset allocations in the above asset classes including any direct investments you may have. 

Thank you very much for your attention to this request. In the event that «Entity» has no such investments, a simple note to this effect will suffice.  We understand that we may be charged for the cost of the copies requested, and agree to pay these charges.  

Please send the requested records via e-mail (foia@preqin.com) or to the following address: 

 Alexandra Marie Oquias 
Preqin Ltd. 
One Grand Central Place 
60 E 42nd Street 
Suite 630, New York 
NY 10165, United States 

Thank you again for your attention to this request.  


Yours faithfully, 
Haley Parker

Good Afternoon,

Please see the attached document per your FOIA request.  The cost for this request is $9.43.  Please send payment to our office, Richmond Retirement System, 730 E. Broad Street, Suite 900, Richmond, VA  23219.

Thank you,
Kia Johnson

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Alameda DA Enhancements
communications.communication:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. Any and all e-mails, memos, and other forms of internal and external communication sent or received by an employee of your office containing or referencing the word "enhancements" occurring between the dates of 1/1/2022 and 7/11/2024. 
2. Any and all relevant responses to the aforementioned communications.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

J

communications.subject: New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act Request: Water Asset Management funds correspondence
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. All email correspondence, with attachments, mentioning "Water Property Investors," "Water Property Investor II," or "Water Property Investor III." 

2. Pitch decks, prospectuses, or any other materials provided to NMERB by the the above funds for consideration of potential investments.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 15 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Julia Rock

communications.subject: Fw: [EXTERNAL] New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act Request: Water Asset Management funds correspondence
communications.communication:
Dear Records Requestor:


Your request for information from the New Mexico Educational Retirement Board was forwarded to me. In accordance with the New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act (IPRA), “a written request shall provide the name, address and telephone number of the person seeking access to the records and shall identify the records sought with reasonable particularity.” Section 14-2-8(C) NMSA 1978.


If you will provide me with your name and mailing address, we can begin the process of allowing inspection of the relevant records.


The Inspection of Public Records Act can be found at 14-2-1 through 14-2-12 NMSA 1978.


Thank you.


Amanda Olsen



Amanda Olsen, Paralegal
NM Educational Retirement Board
PO Box 26129
Santa Fe, New Mexico 87502
(505) 476 6133
(505) 827-8030 fax

communications.subject: RE: New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act Request: Water Asset Management funds correspondence
communications.communication:
Dear Ms. Olsen,

Thanks for your response! My name is Rebecca Burns and my colleague Julia Rock and I are reporters at The Lever, a national investigative outlet. I am making this request as part of ongoing reporting into water issues in the American West. This request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

My mailing address is 4521 N Central Park Ave. 3W, Chicago IL 60625. My phone number is 781-962-8816. Please feel free to give me a call if it's helpful to discuss any portion of this request. 

Thank you!

communications.subject: RE: New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act Request: Water Asset Management funds correspondence
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Scroggins and Ms. Olsen,

Thanks for the update. Can you provide any additional info regarding the source of delays on this request, or the estimated delivery date? Please feel free to give me a call at 781-962-8816 if it'd be helpful to discuss the scope of the materials we're requesting.

communications.subject: RE: New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act Request: Water Asset Management funds correspondence
communications.communication:
Dear Ms. Rock,

I am responding to your email yesterday requesting any additional info regarding the source of delays on this request. Please be assured that we make every effort to respond promptly to every request. However, we must also ensure that we are diligent and accurate in our reply. Thus, when obtained, all documents and emails must be reviewed. Additionally, we must rely on the state agency that controls the entire state email system to identify and provide the emails requested. As you can imagine, the process takes time.

As to an estimated response date, in our letter of August 1, 2023, we noted that we intend to respond by September 6, 2023.

Thank you for your patience and please feel free to contact me if you have further questions.

Respectfully,

[cid:image001.png@01D9C623.0D3F7D80]

communications.subject: RE: New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act Request: Water Asset Management funds correspondence
communications.communication:
Hello Ms. Garcia,

Thank you for the update. Given that it's now been five months since we filed the initial request, are you able to provide an update as to whether you've identified the responsive documents, or what the source of the delay is?

Thank you,

Rebecca

communications.subject: ATTORNEY CLIENT PRIVILEGED - RE: [EXTERNAL] RE: New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act Request: Water Asset Management funds correspondence
communications.communication:
Dear Ms. Rock and Ms. Burns,

Thank you for your inquiry and please accept our apologies for the delay.

As Mr. Scroggins noted in his August 3, 2023 email regarding our projected response, we always try to be prompt.  But as you might guess, the request references a large number of records.  As he said, we must thoroughly review all records to identify and obtain the responsive documents from both external and internal sources.  It is a complex and time-consuming process.

I am confident that we will have documents ready to provide on or before the December 6th, 2023, date noted in our recent communication.

Thank you for your continued patience!
Regards,
Renee



[cid:image002.png@01DA121F.C2136CB0]

files.source: New Mexico Educational Retirement Board, New Mexico

Thanks so much for your help with this request! I really appreciate it.

Sincerely,
Julia Rock

communications.subject: Re: Request for Inspection of Records
communications.communication:
Dear Ms. Rock and Ms. Burns:

As discussed in our letter of December 6, 2023, we are providing the records we currently have available in response to your June 16, 2023, request.  They are located at the website below:

MuckRock - Julia Rock<https://nmgov-my.sharepoint.com/:f:/r/personal/renee_garcia_erb_nm_gov/Documents/MuckRock%20-%20Julia%20Rock?csf=1&web=1&e=4gwfSH>

As also discussed, we will require additional time to provide the remainder of the records.  We plan to provide additional documents on or before February 1, 2024.  Thank you again for your continued patience regarding this matter.
Regards,
Renee



[cid:image001.png@01DA29F0.5D899B00]

MuckRock Staff

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Auderer Claim
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

According to news reports, Former Seattle Police Officer Daniel Auderer has filed a $20 million claim against the City. I am requesting the full and complete claim submitted to the City.
https://komonews.com/news/local/former-seattle-police-department-officer-daniel-auderer-city-of-seattle-20-million-dollar-claim-wrongful-termination-sue-rahr-interim-chief-opa-office-police-accountability

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rose Terse

communications.subject: Legislative Branch :: C192460-080624
communications.communication:
Dear Rose Terse, 
 
Welcome to the City of Seattle Public Records Request Center (PRRC). Your request was received on August 06, 2024 and is appended below. 
 
The reference number for this request is C192460-080624. You will see this number in the title of any communications about this request. 
 
You will hear from a Public Disclosure Officer within five business days regarding the status of your request. 
 
Please visit the City of Seattle Public Records Request Center where you can manage your profile and access your request. Your login ID is: 171117-23285617@requests.muckrock.com
 
If a Public Disclosure Officer submitted your public disclosure request into the PRRC on your behalf, please login and complete your new user account by following these steps: 
 
  * Access the Public Records Request Center 
  * Select 'Forgot my Password' 
  * Enter your 'Login ID' (email address) 
  * A temporary password will be sent to you via email 
  * Login with the temporary password 
You may now visit the PRRC 'My Records Request Center' anytime! 
 
Request C192460-080624:  
" To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

According to news reports, Former Seattle Police Officer Daniel Auderer has filed a $20 million claim against the City. I am requesting the full and complete claim submitted to the City.
https://komonews.com/news/local/former-seattle-police-department-officer-daniel-auderer-city-of-seattle-20-million-dollar-claim-wrongful-termination-sue-rahr-interim-chief-opa-office-police-accountability

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rose Terse

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fseattle-city-clerk-24037%252Fauderer-claim-171117%252F%253Femail%253Dcityclerk%252540seattle.gov&url_auth_token=AADm-CU5ziRHtymjVCgwuflscNA%3A1sbWCR%3Am-xZEwWuadqfzC3dV3ZTXOo826EeuLemQK-Y5fCgiUY"

communications.subject: City of Seattle Public Records Request Center - Invoice Ready :: C192460-080624
communications.communication:
Dear Rose Terse, 
 
Records in response to your public disclosure request C192460-080624 received on August 06, 2024 are now available. The cost for the records is as follows: 
 
Invoice Number: INV24-C192460-1 
Total: $1.25 
 
To pay online, please follow these steps: 
 Please note that you will need to disable any pop-up blockers to make a payment using the system. 
 
  * Navigate to the Public Records Request Center. 
  * Select 'My Records Request Center'. 
  * Select 'View My Requests'. You may be asked to login. 
  * Find this request: C192460-080624. 
  * Select the 'View Invoices' button. 
 
  * Opens a pop-up window showing your invoice: INV24-C192460-1. 
  * Click on the invoice and then the 'Pay Now' button. 
  * Continue processing your payment. 
  * Select 'Done'. 
  * Once the payment process is done, you are returned to the Public Records Request Center. 
  * After your payment is successful you will receive an email from our payments center. 
Once your payment has been approved, we will send you an email with instructions on how to download your records. Note that City staff must manually upload records. Records will be available one to two business days after payment. 
 
Please let your public disclosure officer (PDO) know if you are unable to pay online; your PDO will work with you on alternative ways to make your payment. 
 
You have 30 days from today's date to pay for your records. If the City does not receive your payment within this time period, your request will be considered abandoned, and you will need to submit a new request. 
 Please add seattle@mycusthelp.net to your E-mail contacts/address book to ensure delivery of the record center E-mails to your Inbox. (mailto:seattle@mycusthelp.net) 
This is an auto-generated email and has originated from an unmonitored email account. Please DO NOT REPLY.

Please notice the 'Payment Status' below.  If the payment was successful, you will also receive an email from the City of Seattle Public Records Request Center with additional information regarding your request. 
Confirmation of your payment(s) made on 8/7/2024 1:40:30 PM by Rose Terse for $1.25. 
Account Number: 86487 
Payment Date: 8/7/2024 
Payment Status: AUTHORIZED 
Confirmation Code: 705922 
Payment Amount: $ 1.25 
If the payment was not successful, the 'Confirmation Code' will show 'none'.  Please try the payment process again and if it continues to be unsuccessful, contact the Customer Service Bureau and let them know which department you are requesting records from ( 206-684-2489). 
 Please add COS_Records-Request-Center-Payments@seattle.gov to your E-mail contacts/address book to ensure delivery of the record center E-mails to your Inbox. (mailto:COS_Records-Request-Center-Payments@seattle.gov) 
 
This is an auto-generated email and has originated from an unmonitored email account. Please DO NOT REPLY.

 Within one to two business days, you will receive an email from your public disclosure officer indicating your records are available and instructing you on how to retrieve them. communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 

Dear Rose Terse, 
Records are now available in response to your request C192460-080624 regarding the following: To Whom It May Concern: 

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records: 

According to news reports, Former Seattle Police Officer Daniel Auderer has filed a $20 million claim against the City. I am requesting the full and complete claim submitted to the City. 
https://komonews.com/news/local/former-seattle-police-department-officer-daniel-auderer-city-of-seattle-20-million-dollar-claim-wrongful-termination-sue-rahr-interim-chief-opa-office-police-accountability 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Rose Terse 

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fseattle-city-clerk-24037%252Fauderer-claim-171117%252F%253Femail%253Dcityclerk%252540seattle.gov&url_auth_token=AADm-CU5ziRHtymjVCgwuflscNA%3A1sbWCR%3Am-xZEwWuadqfzC3dV3ZTXOo826EeuLemQK-Y5fCgiUY 
Thank you for getting back to me. The records being made available to you at this time include the claim and the email by which it was delivered to the Office of the City Clerk. 
To download your records, please: 
 
  * Navigate to the Public Records Request Center. 
  * Select 'My Records Request Center'. 
  * Select 'View My Requests'. You may be asked to login. 
  * Select this request: C192460-080624. 
  * Select the 'View Files' button. 
  * You can download records individually or all at the same time by clicking 'Download All'. 
  *  Please save your records as you may only download them from the system three times. If you do not download your records within 30 days of request closure, the link to your records will expire. 
If you believe you have received privileged or confidential records in error, please notify the City of Seattle immediately, through the Public Records Request Center or by email. Privileged or confidential records provided or received in error should not be reviewed, used, disseminated, distributed, or copied, and should be destroyed immediately. Thank you in advance for your cooperation. 
We have provided all records responsive to your request. Your request is now closed. 
Sincerely, 
Matthew C. Jaeger 
(206) 684-8159 
Legislative Department

communications.subject: Customer Satisfaction Survey - C192460-080624
communications.communication:
RE: Public Disclosure Request Number - C192460-080624 
 
Dear Rose Terse: 
 
Thank you for submitting your public records request through the City of Seattle's Public Records Request Center. We would like to invite you to take a short six-question survey on your experience. 
 
Please click the following link if you would like to participate.

title: Law Enforcement Agencies Accessing the New Jersey Motor Vehicle Commission's Face Recognition System

communications.subject: New Jersey Open Public Records Act Request: Law Enforcement Agencies Accessing the New Jersey Motor Vehicle Commission's Face Recognition System
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New Jersey Open Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I would like to learn: 1) which local, state and national law enforcement agencies can currently submit probe photos to be run through the Motor Vehicle Commission's  face recognition system, and 2) which law enforcement agencies actually submitted probe photos to the Motor Vehicle Commission for a search from January 1, 2020 to the date of the most recently available data.

Please provide any lists, logs or datasets showing this information.  With regard to agencies that have submitted probe photos, please provide logs, lists or datasets describing, as available, the requesting organization, the number of requests made, the dates of the requests, and the number of requests granted.  If the Commission maintains this information in an Excel spreadsheet, I request that the record be produced in this format.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Paul Tepper

title: Request for Ice-T's Army personnel records

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Request for Ice-T's Army personnel records
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

A copy of the U.S. Coast Guard personnel records (OMPF) for a former servicemember named TRACY LAUREN MARROW (DATE OF BIRTH: 03/16/1958). Mr. Marrow was born in Newark, New Jersey. He served in the U.S. Coast Guard from 1977 to 1979 and achieved the rank of petty officer, second class. The requested records include performance reports, job assessments, disciplinary records, training received, discharge papers, and any other releasable records.

The public interest in Mr. Marrow, known popularly as the rapper Ice-T, should favor disclosure of many of these records, particularly in relation to any disciplinary records, should those records exist.

Please be sure to review and release any segregable information, even if certain documents or portions of documents are withheld.

PLEASE NOTE: I am not a next of kin of this servicemember, and thus do not know Mr. Marrow’s Social Security Number. Because of this, I am ONLY requesting records releasable under the Freedom of Information Act. Please process my request for this servicemember's OMPF and other records under the Freedom of Information Act’s relevant provisions. I am not seeking any records that would be releasable under the Privacy Act.

I am the Director of Research Operations at a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization called The Decoding Culture Foundation. These documents will be used for public education and research purposes. I therefore request a waiver of all fees that may otherwise apply. Attached is a document with organization letterhead confirming my position, as well as the organization's 501(c)(3) application and approval form.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brett Carollo

communications.subject: Re: Colorado Open Records Act Request: Jimmy Jones CAD Files (Pagosa Springs Police Department)
communications.communication:
Hello Samuel Newton,

In response to your records request, the Pagosa Springs Police Department
does not have any written reports concerning Jimmy Jones.  The police
department did have contact with Mr. Jones on 10-06-2021, Call for Service
Report number #21-16942 and on 06-21-2022 Call for Service Report number
#22-19418.  To obtain those records please contact Archuleta County
Dispatch Center.  Any digital video associated with contact with Mr. Jones
has been destroyed per policy, Colorado Municipal Records Retention
Schedule 100.080(g).

 Please contact me if you have any questions or further information.

Thank you,
Janette





--

Thank you for clarifying.

I'd like to ammend my request with the following:

Pursuant to the Colorado Open Records Act (CORA), I am requesting access to and a copy of the logs of all CORA requests submitted to your agency over the past 180 days. This request includes, but is not limited to, the dates of requests, the nature of the requests, the responses provided, and any associated correspondence.

Please provide the requested records in an electronic format if possible. If there are any fees for searching, reviewing, or copying the records, please inform me before processing my request. Additionally, if you need any further information or clarification to locate these records, please let me know at your earliest convenience.

Thank you for your assistance and prompt attention to this matter.

Hi Samuel. Will you please clarify what you are seeking in terms of "responses provided?" In other words, are you seeking the Town's written responses to CORA requests received over the past 180 days or are you also seeking the underlying records? Additionally, I'd like to confirm that you want logs of all CORA requests received over the past 180, unlimited by subject, requester, etc.?

communications.subject: Re: Colorado Open Records Act Request: Jimmy Jones CAD Files (Pagosa Springs Police Department)
communications.communication:
Good morning,
Pagosa Springs Police Department retains the CORA request for two (2) years
according to the  Colorado Municipal Retention Schedule 100.080(Q).  In the
year of 2022 and 2023, a log was not generated.  The CORA request forms
completed by victims will need to be redacted with any other non
releasable information and a redaction fee of $33.58 per hour, not
including the first hour, will be charged.  If you are requesting only the
police department's response to the cora request, I can send these to you
without a fee.  Can you please clarify what information you are seeking?
1) Requestor's information?
2) Police response (granted or denied)?

Thank you for your patience,
Janette


--

communications.communication:
Good Morning Samuel, 

The Pagosa Springs Police Department does not have any documents related to any court actions related to Jimmy Jones, nor has it received related correspondence from the Attorney General's Office or complaints. 

Will you please clarify your question/specify a timeline regarding Writs of Mandamus? Whether the Department has "ever" received these documents is an overly broad request. 

In general and to the extent possible, please compile any additional questions into one request with sufficient specificity and time ranges. While the Department wants to effectively respond to your request, it must keep in mind the limited resources/staffing it has to do so.

communications.communication:
I'd like to search the past 180 days and if nothing comes up search the past 360 days. 

Thank you for you assistance.

Hi Samuel, 

The Town has not received any Writs of Mandamus in regard to any FOI, CORA, CJRA request in the past 360 days.

communications.subject: RE: Colorado Open Records Act Request: Jimmy Jones CAD Files (Pagosa Springs Police Department)
communications.communication:
I am writing to clarify a terminology used in a recent communication regarding my Colorado Open Records Act (CORA) request.

It has come to my attention that in my previous correspondence, the term "Writ of Mandus" was used in error. The correct legal term is "Writ of Mandamus." A Writ of Mandamus is a judicial remedy in the form of an order from a court to any government subordinate court, corporation, or public authority to do some specific act which that body is obliged under law to do.

Please accept this correction and proceed with processing my original request, as submitted, under the corrected terminology.

I would appreciate a confirmation that this request will be processed without further delay and according to the corrected legal term. Should there be any questions or need for further clarification, please feel free to contact me.

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter.

communications.subject: RE: Colorado Open Records Act Request: Jimmy Jones CAD Files (Pagosa Springs Police Department)
communications.communication:
As far back as March 2020?
Have you received any matching documents?

Hi Samuel, 

As noted in the August 7th response, we have processed your request using the term "Writs of Mandamus." Additionally, the Pagosa Springs Police Department has not received any Writs of Mandamus or matching documents, to include court documents related to open records violations.

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Enbridge Inc.'s Algonquin Pipeline Expansion
communications.communication:
New York State Department of Environmental Conservation
ATTN: FOIA Requester Service
625 Broadway, Albany, NY 12233
Email: foia@dec.ny.gov

Re: Freedom of Information Act Request

Dear NYSDEC FOIA Requester Service Center,

Subject: Request for Records on Enbridge Inc.'s Algonquin Pipeline Expansion

I am writing under the Freedom of Information Act (5 U.S.C. § 552) to request comprehensive records related to the Algonquin Pipeline Expansion, specifically focusing on the role and responsibilities of Enbridge Inc., the company owning and operating the pipeline.

My request includes, but is not limited to, the following records:

Environmental Impact Assessments and Statements conducted by or submitted to NYSDEC regarding the Algonquin Pipeline Expansion, including Enbridge Inc.’s involvement.
Permits and Approvals issued to Enbridge Inc. for the Algonquin Pipeline Expansion, along with any conditions or stipulations.
Correspondence and Communications between NYSDEC and Enbridge Inc. related to environmental assessments, compliance, or violations.
Compliance Reports and Violation Notices issued to Enbridge Inc. concerning the pipeline expansion.
Internal Memos and Evaluations within NYSDEC regarding Enbridge Inc.’s environmental management, risk assessments, and mitigation strategies for the pipeline expansion.
Public Consultation and Comments Records related to the Algonquin Pipeline Expansion, particularly those mentioning Enbridge Inc.
Legal Basis for Request:

Freedom of Information Law (Public Officers Law Article 6)
Case Law: Environmental Protection Agency v. Mink, 410 U.S. 73 (1973) and NLRB v. Robbins Tire & Rubber Co., 437 U.S. 214 (1978) for transparency in government operations and activities.
Fee Waiver Request:
I request a waiver of all fees for this request, as the disclosure is in the public interest, contributing significantly to public understanding of government operations and activities, particularly regarding environmental impact and corporate accountability (5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(4)(A)(iii)).

FOIA Compliance:
In line with Department of Justice v. Tax Analysts, 492 U.S. 136 (1989), I expect adherence to principles of transparency and public access to information.

Response in Case of Denial:
Please provide detailed justifications for any denial, citing specific FOIA exemptions or reasons as per New York State guidelines.

Correspondence Tracking:
Kindly provide a unique FOIA request number for this inquiry.

I look forward to your response within the statutory period as outlined in New York State's FOIA guidelines.

Sincerely,

Jordan Lassiter

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Antioch ShotSpotter Contract
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

The most recent contract (i.e. council resolution, contract extension, contract amendments, cure notices, or other revisions to agreements) between the city and SoundThinking, Inc., formerly ShotSpotter, Inc.. This document(s) should include the total cost over the life of the contract and the current expiration date.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Sophia Ludt
