communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Awaiting Requested Information
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Hi,

I have been awaiting information regarding FOIA Request 2022-04734 that was originally sent on 01/10/2022.  Due to no response, the request was resent on 02/18/2022 from a new email address, with a response from Ms. Shipp acknowledging the receipt of the request via the updated email address.  Ms. Richardson replied utilizing the original document email address instead of utilizing the newly provided email address that was acknowledged by Ms. Shipp.  I have followed-up on two occasions with Ms. Richardson, previously 04/24/2022 with requesting information about a response regarding FOIA Request 2022-04734 and just made a response to Ms. Richardson regarding May 16, 2022 date.  Since it is past the proposed date (May 16, 2022) by Ms. Richardson, I am willing to extend the date for an additional 5 days from today.

Below is a sample letter sent for requested information that remains the same to date.

"LaAsia Cesar 

01/10/2022

Federal Aviation Administration
Eastern Service Area Air Traffic Organization FOIA Coordinator, AJO-2E5
P.O Box 20636
Atlanta, GA 30320

 Dear FOIA Coordinator:

This is a request under the Freedom of Information Act.

I request that a copy of the following documents to be provided to me for all aircraft via aviation that have been requested to hide, block, obscure, or limit access to aircraft registration records. Please provide information at and near 30031 Deanwood Rd. Princess Anne, MD 21853 within .25 miles radius.  Information may include Block Aircraft Registration Request (BARR List), Aircraft Situation Display to Industry (ASDI) or National Business Aviation Association (NBAA) subscriber-level blocking lists, also known as ASDI Block or NBAA Block.  Aircrafts of this search can include the altitudes of ground level (0 ft) to 15,000 ft level for aircraft on dates that are provided.  Dates requested are from February 1, 2020 to January 10, 2022; including a list of dates per aircraft flight and flight number. 

Please explain if any information has been omitted and reason to omit the requested information.

The Free Dictionary defines an “aircraft” as “a machine or device, such as an airplane, helicopter, glider, or dirigible, capable of atmospheric flight.” (aircraft, n.d.)
 
Flight information may include:

1.        Air Force Aircraft Aviation use within .25 miles

2.       Army Aviation use within .25 miles

3.       Coast Guard Aviation use within .25 miles

4.       Marine Corps Aviation use within .25 miles

5.       Navy Aviation use within .25 miles

6.       Space Force Aviation use within .25 miles

7.       Surrounding Airports Aviation use within .25 miles

8.       Police Aviation use within .25 miles

9.       Personal Aviation use within .25 miles

 

In order to determine my status to assess fees, you should know that I am an individual seeking information for personal use.  Additionally, I will be thankful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance by explaining the charges and the reason for the charges via email.

The maximum dollar amount I am willing to pay for this request is $25. Please notify me if the fees will exceed $25.00 or the maximum dollar amount I entered.  It will be a pleasure to pay for these charges electronically through the use a secure payment site.

Thank you for your consideration of this request and I look forward to reviewing your response to this request within 20 business days per the statue with FAA.

Sincerely,

LaAsia Cesar"

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

LAASIA CESAR

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request: Awaiting Requested Information
communications.communication:
Tis appeal letter will be sent to the :
National Freedom of Information Act Office, AFN-400
Federal Aviation Administration
800 Independence Avenue, SW
Washington, DC 20591
(202) 267-9165

Re: FOIA Request 2022-04734

Dear FOIA Representative,

This is an appeal pursuant to 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(6)(1990), concerning information at and near 30031 Deanwood Road, Princess Anne, MD, 21853 within a .25 miles radius, to include ASDI, BARR list and NBAA Block records from February 1, 2020 to January 10, 2022. The response from an FOIA Representative was provided stating that “FOIA Exemption 3. FOIA Exemption 3 permits withholding of records specifically exempted from disclosure by another Federal statute. In this instance, 10 USC § 130e states, in part, that the Department of Defense (DOD) may exempt critical infrastructure security information where such disclosure would reveal vulnerabilities that, if exploited, would likely result in the significant disruption, destruction, or damage of or to DOD operations, property or facilities. In a letter dated June 2, 2017, the DOD informed the FAA that DOD flight data constitutes DOD Critical Infrastructure Information (DCRIT) and is therefore exempt from disclosure in accordance with this statute” signed by Virginia Boyle Vice President, System Operations Services Air Traffic Organization and emailed by Angella Martin-Osorio.

Some alleged laws have been included regarding the redacted information:
1.  Section 242 of Title 18 
2.  Privacy Act of 1974 
3.  The Posse Comitatus Act
4.  The Insurrection Act of 1807 
5.  18 U.S. Code § 1113
6.  Redacted information does not coincide with the 16 different critical infrastructures
7.  Additional information about laws and regulations have been provided via the attached appeal document.

communications.subject: RE: CORA Request | Colorado LIHTC QCs
communications.communication:
Good afternoon,

Thank you for your patience while we researched your CORA request.

CHFA’s Qualified Allocation Plan (QAP) requires applicants to waive their right to request a Qualified Contract. Therefore, it is not a current practice to collect and retain Qualified Contracts. To the best of our knowledge, before this requirement in the QAP, three requests for Qualified Contracts were made, and one request was pursued by the owner. Based on CHFA’s record retention policy, that document is no longer on file with CHFA.

The list you requested is not an existing document, however, attached is the recorded termination agreement of the Land Use Restrictive Agreement (LURA) of the one development that pursued a Qualified Contract.

If you have any further questions, please reach out to Matt Lynn, CHFA’s media liaison, for any further assistance.

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Inspector General closed cases 2016 (Defense Intelligence Agency, Office of the Inspector General)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

a copy of the list or printout or database listing of Inspector General investigations closed/reports completed during calendar year 2016. If the list is organized by FY rather than calendar year, the FY 2016 list is sufficient for this request. If no central list or database exists, then I request that the equivalent information be provided in the form of copies of the cover sheet or first page of each IG report completed during calendar year 2016.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Emma Best

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: OFL Reorganization
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I was seeking any documents in the offices of former Attorney General Jefferson Sessions or any of his deputies about the reorganization of the 'Offices of Foreign Litigation' including but not limited to the removal of the UK office address from the Department of Justice Website.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

William Fernandes

title: Clover Park School District – Request for a complete electronic copy of all Public Records Requests received by the District including District Responses for the years 2010 - 2021
tags: clover park school board member paul wagemann
clover park school board member carole jacobs
clover park school board member anthony veliz
clover park school board member alyssa anderson pearson
clover park school board member dr. marty schafer

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Clover Park School District – Request for a complete electronic copy of all Public Records Requests received by the District including District Responses for the years 2010 - 2021
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act [RCW 42.56] I hereby request the following records:

I request a complete electronic copy of all Public Records Requests received by Clover Park School District and a complete electronic copy of the District's Responses to these Public Records Requests for the time period January 1, 2010 through November 4, 2021.

In the event the District chooses to provide these records in installments over time I request the records to be produced in reverse chronological order - from the most recent records to the earliest.

If this request is denied in whole or part, I ask that you justify all deletions by reference to specific exemptions of the PRA. I also request a detailed contemporaneous log to be provided for any document withheld or redacted.

For each responsive record the District contends is exempt from public disclosure, in whole or in part, please specifically identify the record by subject, title, author, custodian and date, and state how a specific statutory exemption applies to each record as required by RCW 42.56.210(3) and Rental Housing Ass'n v. Des Moines, 165 Wn.2d 525, 199 P.3d 393 (2009).

I request electronic production of all electronic records in the original NATIVE electronic format for each record. 

I request for these public records to be produced by public (no password) e-mail attachment or link. If electronic attachment or link is not possible, an alternative would be to produce responsive records via USB DRIVE or DATA CD-ROM.

THIS REQUEST IS NOT BEING MADE FOR COMMERCIAL PURPOSES.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

PRA Audit

communications.subject: Re: Washington Public Records Act Request: Clover Park School District – Request for a complete electronic copy of all Public Records Requests received by the District including District Responses for the years 2010 - 2021
communications.communication:
Dear PRA Audit,



The Clover Park School District received your public records request on November 5, 2021. Your request seeks all public records requests received by the District from January 1, 2010 through November 4, 2021, as well as a complete electronic copy of the District’s responses to those requests.



You have requested “electronic production of all electronic records in the original NATIVE format for each record.” The vast majority of records the District has disclosed in response to public records requests since 2010 have not been produced in native format, and instead were produced in formats such as .pdf. And as noted earlier, you have requested “a complete electronic copy of the District’s Responses” to public records requests during the time period in question, and such responses typically did not contain native format records. In light of this conflict, the District interprets your request as seeking the District’s previous disclosure communications in their native format, recognizing that those disclosure communications will often contain non-native files. For example, the District would produce to you the native format email of its response to a given public records request, which may include attached responsive records in pdf format that were actually produced to a requestor. Please let me know if you disagree with this interpretation of your request.



Next, please be aware that the District may no longer possess copies of older public records requests and/or District responses. In that event, the District would be unable to disclose copies of such requests and responses.



Per District Procedure 4040P and RCW 42.56.120, the District charges the following fees for electronic copies of records:



1.     Ten cents per page for public records scanned into an electronic format or for the use of district equipment to scan the records;

2.     Five cents per each four electronic files or attachments uploaded to email, cloud-based data storage service, or other means of electronic delivery;

3.     Ten cents per gigabyte for the transmission of public records in an electronic format or for the use of district equipment to send the records electronically; and

4.     The actual cost of any digital storage media or device provided by the district, the actual cost of any container or envelope used to mail the copies to the requestor, and the actual postage or delivery charge.



Any applicable copying costs must be received by the District before the District discloses records. Additionally, District Procedure 4040P and RCW 42.56.120 authorize the District to require a deposit of up to ten percent of the total estimated costs of providing copies for a request. The District has not yet had an opportunity to determine how many responsive records there will be, or what the total estimated cost of fulfilling the request will be. Prior to providing the first installment of records for this request, we will contact you to let you know the total estimated cost and the deposit amount due. Following receipt of the deposit, the District will require payment of any applicable copying costs before producing installments.



At this time, the District estimates that it will be able to disclose an initial installment of records by February 4, 2022. I have also submitted your request to our NextRequest Program on November 5, 2021, at 3:29 pm. This will also include our 5-day response from our District.


Thank you.



Aranka Holmes

Coordinator for Public Records, WC Claims, and ADA

[cid:b525986e-eb5d-4ccc-9e3e-be0e3be9d7ee]

Creating Promising Futures.



Student Services Center

10903 Gravelly Lake Dr SW, Lakewood WA  98499-1341

253-583-5083 •  Fax 253-583-5088

If you are not an intended recipient, you are hereby notified that any use, dissemination, distribution, disclosure, or copying of this information is unauthorized and strictly prohibited. communications.subject: [External Message Added] Clover Park School District public records request #21-119
communications.communication:
Clover Park School District ************************************************************************ A message was sent to you regarding record request #21-119: Hello,   The District is currently processing your request and will have the first installment produced to you on February 15, 2022.   I am writing for clarification regarding you request for a “complete electronic copy of all Public Records Requests received by Clover Park School District and a complete electronic copy of the District's Responses to these Public Records Requests for the time period January 1, 2010, through November 4, 2021.” As background, the District processes requests for records under the Public Records Act (PRA), Chapter 42.56 RCW and requests for records under the Family Educational Rights and Privacy Act (FERPA), 34 C.F.R 99, within the same program. FERPA provides families certain rights with regard to their students’ education records, including the ability to review and request their student’s education records. See 34 C.F.R. 99.10. Because the District processes both PRA requests and FERPA requests through the same system, many requests by parents to view their student records have been labelled PRA requests, when in actuality, they were FERPA requests. This means many of the sets of records that appear to have been produced under the PRA were actually produced under FERPA. For example, the first installment to you of responsive records will include about eighty requests for records. Of those 80 requests, 30 sets of records were requested under FERPA, while the rest were requested under the PRA.   The District would like you to clarify whether you are seeking those requests for records which would qualify as FERPA requests, or if you are purely seeking the records produced under the PRA.   The information you requested is unable to be emailed due to size; however, we have copied the requested items onto a flash drive. The cost of the flash drive is as follows:            Thumb/CD drive         $6.00            Postage                           .50           Shipping container      $1.00                                               $7.50   In the event you wish to pick up the thumb drive, you would just be charged for the thumb drive. Otherwise, we will mail the contents to you once payment is received. We accept either cash (needs to be exact change) or check (made payable to Clover Park School District). Please contact me at aholmes@cloverpark.k12.wa.us if you have any questions.   This is the District’s final notice that if you do not provide clarification on these requests, the District will close your request on March 15, 2022. RCW 42.46.520(3)(b); WAC 44-14-04003(8).   Thanks,     Aranka Holmes Human Resources Coordinator for Public Records, WC Claims, and ADA Creating Promising Futures.   Student Services Center 10903 Gravelly Lake Dr SW, Lakewood WA 98499-1341 253-583-5083 • Fax 253-583-5088   IMPORTANT NOTICE: This e-mail message and all attachments, if any, may contain confidential and privileged material and are intended only for the person or entity to which the message is addressed. communications.subject: [External Message Added] Clover Park School District public records request #21-119
communications.communication:
Clover Park School District ************************************************************************ A message was sent to you regarding record request #21-119: Hello, MuckRock, On November 05, 2021, Clover Park School District received your request for public records. This letter serves as the district’s initial response under RCW 42.56.520. You have requested the following: Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act [RCW 42.56] I hereby request the following records: I request a complete electronic copy of all Public Records Requests received by Clover Park School District and a complete electronic copy of the District's Responses to these Public Records Requests for the time period January 1, 2010, through November 4, 2021. This is the final installment of records. The information you requested is unable to be emailed due to size; however, we have copied the requested items onto a flash drive. The cost of the flash drive is as follows:            Thumb/CD drive         $6.00            Postage                          .50            Shipping container      $1.00                                               $7.50 In the event you wish to pick up the thumb drive, you would just be charged for the thumb drive. Otherwise, we will mail the contents to you once payment is received. We accept either cash (needs to be exact change) or checks (made payable to Clover Park School District). Please contact me at: aholmes@cloverpark.k12.wa.us if you have any questions. This is the district’s notice that if you do not provide payment by September 30, 2022, the District will close your request on October 01, 2022. RCW 42.46.523 With this final installment, the district has provided you with the records responsive to your request. Please note that in accordance with the Washington Secretary of State Retention Schedule, the District is not required to retain “records created in the activity of responding to public records requests in accordance with the Public Records Act (chapter 42.56 RCW)” for more than two years, with limited exceptions. I have included the Washington State Government General Records Retention Schedule, Version 6.2 (August 2021) with this response for your review. See Section 5.4, Public Disclosure/Records Request, Disposition Authority Number GS 05001 Rev. 2, at pg. 114. You have requested Public Records Requests and Responses dating back to 2010. Consistent with the applicable retention schedule, the district does not have Public Records Requests and Responses dating back that far and have now provided you the records responsive to your request. Thank you, Aranka Holmes Coordinator for Public Records, WC Claims, ADA, and FMLA   Creating Promising Futures.   Student Services Center 10903 Gravelly Lake Dr. SW, Lakewood WA 98499-1341 253-583-5083 • Fax 253-583-5088   IMPORTANT NOTICE: This e-mail message and all attachments, if any, may contain confidential and privileged material and are intended only for the person or entity to which the message is addressed. If you are not an intended recipient, you are hereby notified that any use, dissemination, distribution, disclosure, or copying of this information is unauthorized and strictly prohibited. If you have received this communication in error, please contact the sender immediately by reply e-mail, and destroy all copies of the original message   ************************************************************************ Questions about your request? Reply to this email or sign in to contact staff at Clover Park School District.

title: Assistant Secretary Catherine Lhamon December 2021 Calendar

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Assistant Secretary Catherine Lhamon December 2021 Calendar
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Assistant Secretary Catherine Lhamon's public calendar for December 2021.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Russel Neiss

communications.subject: Department of Education FOIA Acknowledgment Letter - 22-01812-F
communications.communication:
Dear Russel   Neiss, 

This is the Department's acknowledgment of your request for information pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), 5 U.S.C. § 552. Your request was forwarded to the primary responsible office(s) for action. 

Any future correspondence or questions regarding your request, please contact the FOIA Public Liaison at 202-401-8365 or Thank you. (mailto:EDFOIAManager@ed.gov) EDFOIAManager@ed.gov 

ED FOIA Manager 
FOIA Service Center 
U.S. Department of Education

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #22-01812-F
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

I wanted to follow up on the following Freedom of Information Act request, copied below, and originally submitted on Feb. 2, 2022. Please let me know when I can expect to receive a response.  You had assigned it reference number #22-01812-F.

Thanks for your help, and let me know if further clarification is needed.

communications.subject: 22-01812-F Status Update
communications.communication:
Good Afternoon, 
This e-mail is in response to your request for a status on the subject FOIA requests: # 22-01812-F 
The Department receives an overwhelming amount of FOIA requests, some of which are complex and voluminous that requires a line-by-line review of hundreds or even thousands of pages of documents.  Requests are processed on a first-in-first-out basis. Your request is currently with the program office tasked to search/produce records responsive to your request. 
Please continue check on the status of your request on the Department’s FOIA Web page at http://www2.ed.gov/policy/gen/leg/foia/foiatoc.html and click on the Requests Status Log link under “More Resources.” 
If you have any questions, please contact the FOIA Service Center at (202) 401-8365 or via e-mail at EDFOIAManager@ed.gov. 
Thank You, 
Brittany Davis 
FOIA Service Center 
US Department of Education 
(202) 401-8365

Thanks for your help, and let me know if further clarification is needed.

communications.subject: RE: 22-01812-F Status Update Request
communications.communication:
Good Morning, 

This e-mail is in response to your request for a status on the subject FOIA requests: # 22-01812-F 
The Department receives an overwhelming amount of FOIA requests, some of which are complex and voluminous that requires a line-by-line review of hundreds or even thousands of pages of documents.  Requests are processed on a first-in-first-out basis. Your request is currently with the program office tasked to produce records responsive to your request. We apologize for the delay. 

Please continue to check on the status of your request on the Department’s FOIA Web page at and click on the Requests Status Log link under “More Resources.” http://www2.ed.gov/policy/gen/leg/foia/foiatoc.html (http://www2.ed.gov/policy/gen/leg/foia/foiatoc.html) 
If you have any questions, please contact the FOIA Service Center at (202) 401-8365 or via e-mail at EDFOIAManager@ed.gov. (mailto:EDFOIAManager@ed.gov) 
Thank You, 
FOIA Service Center 
US Department of Education 
(202) 401-8365
